about.name: The following questions are from real DMV written tests. These are some of the actual permit questions you will face in California. Each permit practice test question has three answer choices. Select one answer for each question and select "grade this section." You can find this button at the bottom of the drivers license quiz.  For a complete list of questions and answers for California please visit https://cheat-sheets.dmv-written-test.com/en/california/car.

hasPart.name: A broken yellow line beside a solid yellow line indicates that:

hasPart.assesses: A broken yellow line beside a solid yellow line indicates that: | A broken yellow line beside a solid yellow line indicates that: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: A broken yellow line alongside a solid yellow line means that traffic in the lane next to the broken line may cross the line to pass, while traffic in the lane next to the solid line may not.

suggestedAnswer.text: Passing is permitted from the lane next to the solid yellow line.

comment.text: Passing is permitted from the lane next to the solid yellow line.

suggestedAnswer.text: Passing is not permitted from either direction.

comment.text: Passing is not permitted from either direction.

suggestedAnswer.text: Passing is permitted from the lane next to the broken yellow line.

comment.text: Passing is permitted from the lane next to the broken yellow line.

acceptedAnswer.text: Passing is permitted from the lane next to the broken yellow line.

hasPart.text: If you have been parked on the side of a road, you must yield to existing traffic when re-entering the road.

suggestedAnswer.text: Continue waiting and yielding to traffic in the lane.

comment.text: Continue waiting and yielding to traffic in the lane.

suggestedAnswer.text: Slowly inch your vehicle into the traffic lane.

comment.text: Slowly inch your vehicle into the traffic lane.

suggestedAnswer.text: Drive on the shoulder until a gap in traffic appears.

acceptedAnswer.text: Continue waiting and yielding to traffic in the lane.

comment.text: Continue waiting and yielding to traffic in the lane.

hasPart.text: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. These signs alert drivers to areas where bicycles may be crossing.

comment.text: Bicycle crossing.

suggestedAnswer.text: Stop only if other cars are approaching.

comment.text: Stop only if other cars are approaching.
Yield the right-of-way to pedestrians.
Bicycle crossing.

hasPart.text: Drivers should be alert to the presence of crossing guards when near a school and must always obey their instructions.

comment.text: At all times.
Only during school hours.

suggestedAnswer.text: Unless you do not see any children present.

comment.text: Unless you do not see any children present.
At all times.

hasPart.text: Many roads are most slippery during the first rain after a dry spell because oil and dust on the road have not previously been washed away.

comment.text: During a heavy downpour.

suggestedAnswer.text: After it has been raining for awhile.

comment.text: After it has been raining for awhile.

suggestedAnswer.text: During the first rain after a dry spell.

comment.text: During the first rain after a dry spell.

acceptedAnswer.text: During the first rain after a dry spell.

comment.text: During the first rain after a dry spell.

answerExplanation.text: Many roads are most slippery during the first rain after a dry spell because oil and dust on the road have not previously been washed away.
